 10769 /* A replacement for Posix execvp, used to restart Emacs.  This is
 10770    needed because the low-level Windows API to start processes accepts
 10771    the command-line arguments as a single string, so we cannot safely
 10772    use the MSVCRT execvp emulation, because elements of argv[] that
 10773    have embedded blanks and tabs will not be passed correctly to the
 10774    restarted Emacs.  */
 10775 int
 10776 w32_reexec_emacs (char *cmd_line, const char *wdir)
 10777 {
 10778   STARTUPINFO si;
 10779   BOOL status;
 10780   PROCESS_INFORMATION proc_info;
 10781   DWORD dwCreationFlags = NORMAL_PRIORITY_CLASS;
 10782 
 10783   GetStartupInfo (&si);         /* Use the same startup info as the caller.  */
 10784   if (inhibit_window_system)
 10785     {
 10786       HANDLE screen_handle;
 10787       CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO screen_info;
 10788 
 10789       screen_handle = GetStdHandle (STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
 10790       if (screen_handle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE
 10791           && GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo (screen_handle, &screen_info))
 10792         {
 10793           int font_width, font_height;
 10794 
 10795           /* Make the restarted Emacs's console window the same
 10796              dimensions as ours.  */
 10797           si.dwXCountChars = screen_info.dwSize.X;
 10798           si.dwYCountChars = screen_info.dwSize.Y;
 10799           get_console_font_size (screen_handle, &font_width, &font_height);
 10800           si.dwXSize =
 10801             (screen_info.srWindow.Right - screen_info.srWindow.Left + 1)
 10802             * font_width;
 10803           si.dwYSize =
 10804             (screen_info.srWindow.Bottom - screen_info.srWindow.Top + 1)
 10805             * font_height;
 10806           si.dwFlags |= STARTF_USESIZE | STARTF_USECOUNTCHARS;
 10807         }
 10808       /* This is a kludge: it causes the restarted "emacs -nw" to have
 10809          a new console window created for it, and that new window
 10810          might have different (default) properties, not the ones of
 10811          the parent process's console window.  But without this,
 10812          restarting Emacs in the -nw mode simply doesn't work,
 10813          probably because the parent's console is still in use.
 10814          FIXME!  */
 10815       dwCreationFlags = CREATE_NEW_CONSOLE;
 10816     }
 10817 
 10818   /* Make sure we are in the original directory, in case the command
 10819      line specifies the program as a relative file name.  */
 10820   chdir (wdir);
 10821 
 10822   status = CreateProcess (NULL,         /* no program, take from command line */
 10823                           cmd_line,     /* command line */
 10824                           NULL,
 10825                           NULL,         /* thread attributes */
 10826                           FALSE,        /* unherit handles? */
 10827                           dwCreationFlags,
 10828                           NULL,         /* environment */
 10829                           wdir,         /* initial directory */
 10830                           &si,          /* startup info */
 10831                           &proc_info);
 10832   if (status)
 10833     {
 10834       CloseHandle (proc_info.hThread);
 10835       CloseHandle (proc_info.hProcess);
 10836       exit (0);
 10837     }
 10838   errno = ENOEXEC;
 10839   return -1;
 10840 }
 10841 
 10842 /*
 10843         globals_of_w32 is used to initialize those global variables that
 10844         must always be initialized on startup even when the global variable
 10845         initialized is non zero (see the function main in emacs.c).
 10846 */
 10847 void
 10848 globals_of_w32 (void)
 10849 {
 10850   HMODULE kernel32 = GetModuleHandle ("kernel32.dll");
 10851 
 10852   get_process_times_fn = (GetProcessTimes_Proc)
 10853     get_proc_addr (kernel32, "GetProcessTimes");
 10854 
 10855   DEFSYM (QCloaded_from, ":loaded-from");
 10856 
 10857   g_b_init_is_windows_9x = 0;
 10858   g_b_init_open_process_token = 0;
 10859   g_b_init_get_token_information = 0;
 10860   g_b_init_lookup_account_sid = 0;
 10861   g_b_init_get_sid_sub_authority = 0;
 10862   g_b_init_get_sid_sub_authority_count = 0;
 10863   g_b_init_get_security_info = 0;
 10864   g_b_init_get_file_security_w = 0;
 10865   g_b_init_get_file_security_a = 0;
 10866   g_b_init_get_security_descriptor_owner = 0;
 10867   g_b_init_get_security_descriptor_group = 0;
 10868   g_b_init_is_valid_sid = 0;
 10869   g_b_init_create_toolhelp32_snapshot = 0;
 10870   g_b_init_process32_first = 0;
 10871   g_b_init_process32_next = 0;
 10872   g_b_init_open_thread_token = 0;
 10873   g_b_init_impersonate_self = 0;
 10874   g_b_init_revert_to_self = 0;
 10875   g_b_init_get_process_memory_info = 0;
 10876   g_b_init_get_process_working_set_size = 0;
 10877   g_b_init_global_memory_status = 0;
 10878   g_b_init_global_memory_status_ex = 0;
 10879   g_b_init_equal_sid = 0;
 10880   g_b_init_copy_sid = 0;
 10881   g_b_init_get_length_sid = 0;
 10882   g_b_init_get_native_system_info = 0;
 10883   g_b_init_get_system_times = 0;
 10884   g_b_init_create_symbolic_link_w = 0;
 10885   g_b_init_create_symbolic_link_a = 0;
 10886   g_b_init_get_security_descriptor_dacl = 0;
 10887   g_b_init_convert_sd_to_sddl = 0;
 10888   g_b_init_convert_sddl_to_sd = 0;
 10889   g_b_init_is_valid_security_descriptor = 0;
 10890   g_b_init_set_file_security_w = 0;
 10891   g_b_init_set_file_security_a = 0;
 10892   g_b_init_set_named_security_info_w = 0;
 10893   g_b_init_set_named_security_info_a = 0;
 10894   g_b_init_get_adapters_info = 0;
 10895   g_b_init_get_adapters_addresses = 0;
 10896   g_b_init_reg_open_key_ex_w = 0;
 10897   g_b_init_reg_query_value_ex_w = 0;
 10898   g_b_init_expand_environment_strings_w = 0;
 10899   g_b_init_compare_string_w = 0;
 10900   g_b_init_debug_break_process = 0;
 10901   g_b_init_get_user_default_ui_language = 0;
 10902   g_b_init_get_console_font_size = 0;
 10903   num_of_processors = 0;
 10904   /* The following sets a handler for shutdown notifications for
 10905      console apps. This actually applies to Emacs in both console and
 10906      GUI modes, since we had to fool windows into thinking emacs is a
 10907      console application to get console mode to work.  */
 10908   SetConsoleCtrlHandler (shutdown_handler, TRUE);
 10909 
 10910   /* "None" is the default group name on standalone workstations.  */
 10911   strcpy (dflt_group_name, "None");
 10912 
 10913   /* Reset, in case it has some value inherited from dump time.  */
 10914   w32_stat_get_owner_group = 0;
 10915 
 10916   /* If w32_unicode_filenames is non-zero, we will be using Unicode
 10917      (a.k.a. "wide") APIs to invoke functions that accept file
 10918      names.  */
 10919   if (is_windows_9x ())
 10920     w32_unicode_filenames = 0;
 10921   else
 10922     w32_unicode_filenames = 1;
 10923 
 10924 #ifdef HAVE_MODULES
 10925   dynlib_reset_last_error ();
 10926 #endif
 10927 
 10928   w32_crypto_hprov = (HCRYPTPROV)0;
 10929 
 10930   /* We need to forget about libraries that were loaded during the
 10931      dumping process (e.g. libgccjit) */
 10932   Vlibrary_cache = Qnil;
 10933 }
 10934 
 10935 /* For make-serial-process  */
 10936 int
 10937 serial_open (Lisp_Object port_obj)
 10938 {
 10939   char *port = SSDATA (port_obj);
 10940   HANDLE hnd;
 10941   child_process *cp;
 10942   int fd = -1;
 10943 
 10944   hnd = CreateFile (port, GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE, 0, 0,
 10945                     OPEN_EXISTING, FILE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED, 0);
 10946   if (hnd == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
 10947     error ("Could not open %s", port);
 10948   fd = (int) _open_osfhandle ((intptr_t) hnd, 0);
 10949   if (fd == -1)
 10950     error ("Could not open %s", port);
 10951 
 10952   cp = new_child ();
 10953   if (!cp)
 10954     error ("Could not create child process");
 10955   cp->fd = fd;
 10956   cp->status = STATUS_READ_ACKNOWLEDGED;
 10957   fd_info[ fd ].hnd = hnd;
 10958   fd_info[ fd ].flags |=
 10959     FILE_READ | FILE_WRITE | FILE_BINARY | FILE_SERIAL;
 10960   if (fd_info[ fd ].cp != NULL)
 10961     {
 10962       error ("fd_info[fd = %d] is already in use", fd);
 10963     }
 10964   fd_info[ fd ].cp = cp;
 10965   cp->ovl_read.hEvent = CreateEvent (NULL, TRUE, FALSE, NULL);
 10966   if (cp->ovl_read.hEvent == NULL)
 10967       error ("Could not create read event");
 10968   cp->ovl_write.hEvent = CreateEvent (NULL, TRUE, FALSE, NULL);
 10969   if (cp->ovl_write.hEvent == NULL)
 10970       error ("Could not create write event");
 10971 
 10972   return fd;
 10973 }
 10974 
 10975 /* For serial-process-configure  */
 10976 void
 10977 serial_configure (struct Lisp_Process *p, Lisp_Object contact)
 10978 {
 10979   Lisp_Object childp2 = Qnil;
 10980   Lisp_Object tem = Qnil;
 10981   HANDLE hnd;
 10982   DCB dcb;
 10983   COMMTIMEOUTS ct;
 10984   char summary[4] = "???"; /* This usually becomes "8N1".  */
 10985 
 10986   if ((fd_info[ p->outfd ].flags & FILE_SERIAL) == 0)
 10987     error ("Not a serial process");
 10988   hnd = fd_info[ p->outfd ].hnd;
 10989 
 10990   childp2 = Fcopy_sequence (p->childp);
 10991 
 10992   /* Initialize timeouts for blocking read and blocking write.  */
 10993   if (!GetCommTimeouts (hnd, &ct))
 10994     error ("GetCommTimeouts() failed");
 10995   ct.ReadIntervalTimeout         = 0;
 10996   ct.ReadTotalTimeoutMultiplier  = 0;
 10997   ct.ReadTotalTimeoutConstant    = 0;
 10998   ct.WriteTotalTimeoutMultiplier = 0;
 10999   ct.WriteTotalTimeoutConstant   = 0;
 11000   if (!SetCommTimeouts (hnd, &ct))
 11001     error ("SetCommTimeouts() failed");
 11002   /* Read port attributes and prepare default configuration.  */
 11003   memset (&dcb, 0, sizeof (dcb));
 11004   dcb.DCBlength = sizeof (DCB);
 11005   if (!GetCommState (hnd, &dcb))
 11006     error ("GetCommState() failed");
 11007   dcb.fBinary       = TRUE;
 11008   dcb.fNull         = FALSE;
 11009   dcb.fAbortOnError = FALSE;
 11010   /* dcb.XonLim and dcb.XoffLim are set by GetCommState() */
 11011   dcb.ErrorChar     = 0;
 11012   dcb.EofChar       = 0;
 11013   dcb.EvtChar       = 0;
 11014 
 11015   /* Configure speed.  */
 11016   if (!NILP (plist_member (contact, QCspeed)))
 11017     tem = plist_get (contact, QCspeed);
 11018   else
 11019     tem = plist_get (p->childp, QCspeed);
 11020   CHECK_FIXNUM (tem);
 11021   dcb.BaudRate = XFIXNUM (tem);
 11022   childp2 = plist_put (childp2, QCspeed, tem);
 11023 
 11024   /* Configure bytesize.  */
 11025   if (!NILP (plist_member (contact, QCbytesize)))
 11026     tem = plist_get (contact, QCbytesize);
 11027   else
 11028     tem = plist_get (p->childp, QCbytesize);
 11029   if (NILP (tem))
 11030     tem = make_fixnum (8);
 11031   CHECK_FIXNUM (tem);
 11032   if (XFIXNUM (tem) != 7 && XFIXNUM (tem) != 8)
 11033     error (":bytesize must be nil (8), 7, or 8");
 11034   dcb.ByteSize = XFIXNUM (tem);
 11035   summary[0] = XFIXNUM (tem) + '0';
 11036   childp2 = plist_put (childp2, QCbytesize, tem);
 11037 
 11038   /* Configure parity.  */
 11039   if (!NILP (plist_member (contact, QCparity)))
 11040     tem = plist_get (contact, QCparity);
 11041   else
 11042     tem = plist_get (p->childp, QCparity);
 11043   if (!NILP (tem) && !EQ (tem, Qeven) && !EQ (tem, Qodd))
 11044     error (":parity must be nil (no parity), `even', or `odd'");
 11045   dcb.fParity = FALSE;
 11046   dcb.Parity = NOPARITY;
 11047   dcb.fErrorChar = FALSE;
 11048   if (NILP (tem))
 11049     {
 11050       summary[1] = 'N';
 11051     }
 11052   else if (EQ (tem, Qeven))
 11053     {
 11054       summary[1] = 'E';
 11055       dcb.fParity = TRUE;
 11056       dcb.Parity = EVENPARITY;
 11057       dcb.fErrorChar = TRUE;
 11058     }
 11059   else if (EQ (tem, Qodd))
 11060     {
 11061       summary[1] = 'O';
 11062       dcb.fParity = TRUE;
 11063       dcb.Parity = ODDPARITY;
 11064       dcb.fErrorChar = TRUE;
 11065     }
 11066   childp2 = plist_put (childp2, QCparity, tem);
 11067 
 11068   /* Configure stopbits.  */
 11069   if (!NILP (plist_member (contact, QCstopbits)))
 11070     tem = plist_get (contact, QCstopbits);
 11071   else
 11072     tem = plist_get (p->childp, QCstopbits);
 11073   if (NILP (tem))
 11074     tem = make_fixnum (1);
 11075   CHECK_FIXNUM (tem);
 11076   if (XFIXNUM (tem) != 1 && XFIXNUM (tem) != 2)
 11077     error (":stopbits must be nil (1 stopbit), 1, or 2");
 11078   summary[2] = XFIXNUM (tem) + '0';
 11079   if (XFIXNUM (tem) == 1)
 11080     dcb.StopBits = ONESTOPBIT;
 11081   else if (XFIXNUM (tem) == 2)
 11082     dcb.StopBits = TWOSTOPBITS;
 11083   childp2 = plist_put (childp2, QCstopbits, tem);
 11084 
 11085   /* Configure flowcontrol.  */
 11086   if (!NILP (plist_member (contact, QCflowcontrol)))
 11087     tem = plist_get (contact, QCflowcontrol);
 11088   else
 11089     tem = plist_get (p->childp, QCflowcontrol);
 11090   if (!NILP (tem) && !EQ (tem, Qhw) && !EQ (tem, Qsw))
 11091     error (":flowcontrol must be nil (no flowcontrol), `hw', or `sw'");
 11092   dcb.fOutxCtsFlow      = FALSE;
 11093   dcb.fOutxDsrFlow      = FALSE;
 11094   dcb.fDtrControl       = DTR_CONTROL_DISABLE;
 11095   dcb.fDsrSensitivity   = FALSE;
 11096   dcb.fTXContinueOnXoff = FALSE;
 11097   dcb.fOutX             = FALSE;
 11098   dcb.fInX              = FALSE;
 11099   dcb.fRtsControl       = RTS_CONTROL_DISABLE;
 11100   dcb.XonChar           = 17; /* Control-Q  */
 11101   dcb.XoffChar          = 19; /* Control-S  */
 11102   if (NILP (tem))
 11103     {
 11104       /* Already configured.  */
 11105     }
 11106   else if (EQ (tem, Qhw))
 11107     {
 11108       dcb.fRtsControl = RTS_CONTROL_HANDSHAKE;
 11109       dcb.fOutxCtsFlow = TRUE;
 11110     }
 11111   else if (EQ (tem, Qsw))
 11112     {
 11113       dcb.fOutX = TRUE;
 11114       dcb.fInX = TRUE;
 11115     }
 11116   childp2 = plist_put (childp2, QCflowcontrol, tem);
 11117 
 11118   /* Activate configuration.  */
 11119   if (!SetCommState (hnd, &dcb))
 11120     error ("SetCommState() failed");
 11121 
 11122   childp2 = plist_put (childp2, QCsummary, build_string (summary));
 11123   pset_childp (p, childp2);
 11124 }
 11125 
 11126 /* For make-pipe-process */
 11127 void
 11128 register_aux_fd (int infd)
 11129 {
 11130   child_process *cp;
 11131 
 11132   cp = new_child ();
 11133   if (!cp)
 11134     error ("Could not create child process");
 11135   cp->fd = infd;
 11136   cp->status = STATUS_READ_ACKNOWLEDGED;
 11137 
 11138   if (fd_info[ infd ].cp != NULL)
 11139     {
 11140       error ("fd_info[fd = %d] is already in use", infd);
 11141     }
 11142   fd_info[ infd ].cp = cp;
 11143   fd_info[ infd ].hnd = (HANDLE) _get_osfhandle (infd);
 11144   fd_info[ infd ].flags |= FILE_DONT_CLOSE;
 11145 }
 11146 
 11147 #ifdef HAVE_GNUTLS
 11148 
 11149 ssize_t
 11150 emacs_gnutls_pull (gnutls_transport_ptr_t p, void* buf, size_t sz)
 11151 {
 11152   int n, err;
 11153   struct Lisp_Process *process = (struct Lisp_Process *)p;
 11154   int fd = process->infd;
 11155 
 11156   n = sys_read (fd, (char*)buf, sz);
 11157 
 11158   if (n >= 0)
 11159     return n;
 11160 
 11161   err = errno;
 11162 
 11163   /* Translate the WSAEWOULDBLOCK alias EWOULDBLOCK to EAGAIN. */
 11164   if (err == EWOULDBLOCK)
 11165     err = EAGAIN;
 11166 
 11167   emacs_gnutls_transport_set_errno (process->gnutls_state, err);
 11168 
 11169   return -1;
 11170 }
 11171 
 11172 ssize_t
 11173 emacs_gnutls_push (gnutls_transport_ptr_t p, const void* buf, size_t sz)
 11174 {
 11175   struct Lisp_Process *process = (struct Lisp_Process *)p;
 11176   int fd = process->outfd;
 11177   ssize_t n = sys_write (fd, buf, sz);
 11178 
 11179   /* 0 or more bytes written means everything went fine.  */
 11180   if (n >= 0)
 11181     return n;
 11182 
 11183   /* Negative bytes written means we got an error in errno.
 11184      Translate the WSAEWOULDBLOCK alias EWOULDBLOCK to EAGAIN.  */
 11185   emacs_gnutls_transport_set_errno (process->gnutls_state,
 11186                                     errno == EWOULDBLOCK ? EAGAIN : errno);
 11187 
 11188   return -1;
 11189 }
 11190 #endif /* HAVE_GNUTLS */
 11191 
 11192 /* end of w32.c */
/* [<][>][^][v][top][bottom][index][help] */
